instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Black screen
threads.message:
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, it turns on normally, but no display.

It displays image to an external monitor, but its own LCD remains black like it has not been plugged in the board.

L8300 at 5V without LCD plugged, and 0v with it.
<CAPACITOR>C8320</CAPACITOR>-<CAPACITOR>C8328</CAPACITOR> on the place
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> missing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Black screen
threads.message:
5V MUST appear in the first few seconds w/ or w/o LCD connected.
But will disappear fast if LCD is not connected.
Once LCD is correctly recognized by PCH, voltage is maintained.

Keep LCD connected, when diagnose image, or backlight problems.
Check if <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> goes high at same time with 5V on L8300.
If yes, post <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Black screen
threads.message:
5.171V present at L8300 when LCD is connected.
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> 0V with or without LCD connected.
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 49.39V
<SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> - 0V as well
